column1: Fantastic time stopping by the Kickoff to 2020 Winter Potluck hosted by the @FrederickDems. There’s lots of excitement in the county as we look forward to the election this year. Thanks to Chairwoman Deborah Carter for inviting me. https://t.co/Nffl0BA4Ja

Today history is made as @SpeakerAJones is sworn in as Maryland House Speaker. Looking forward to continuing our strong state and federal partnership that works to make progress #ForThePeople of Maryland. https://t.co/MQFZB13Q6F

My family like so many others has been affected by Alzheimer’s Disease.   @RushernBaker and I wrote about the importance of fully funding research at the NIH to find a cure to a disease affecting 6 million Americans.  It’s time to get to work. https://t.co/2pEXp02mRr
There’s no better place to experience the outdoors and some fresh Maryland air. You’re welcome anytime to the 6th district @SenBillFerg! https://t.co/fa45Uxpm5a
Happy Thanksgiving from my family to yours! https://t.co/dFRSPozXp4

The first Thanksgiving at Brooke’s House was filled with love and support. Congratulations to Kevin and Dana Simmers for opening this magnificent facility and providing a safe place for women in Hagerstown to enter recovery. https://t.co/JJTj3YmUzM

Today I’m grateful for my family our service members who are overseas and our democracy. As my first year in Congress comes to a close I couldn’t be more honored to fight for the 6th District Maryland and our democratic values in Congress. Thank you. https://t.co/gPnKX91SBl

#TeamTrone joined @MannaFoodCenter this week to pack 240 boxes of food! Manna Food Center is committed to fighting hunger in Montgomery County. Thank you for having us and for all the hard work you do in our community. https://t.co/ruDn0EwXNW

Thank you to @SpeakerAJones & Dr. Lora Hargrove for your opening remarks and everyone who came out to be part of this conversation. If we are going to make positive change in this country all of us must come together to stand up for our rights our Constitution and our future. https://t.co/FyG2n9D8m3

Speaker Pelosi is the highest ranking elected woman that we’ve ever had in government & she got her start right here in Maryland. If there ever was a moment that showed why we are proud of our Speaker it was when she literally stood up to President Trump at the White House. https://t.co/5Jh7gft434

This past weekend I was honored to host House Speaker @TeamPelosi and over 1300 people at Gaithersburg High School to talk about the progress we are making in the House for the people. https://t.co/Vg5htP3yPy
Congratulations to Gaithersburg City Councilmen Neil Harris Ryan Spiegel and Robert Wu on their re-election!  https://t.co/lDY3Sf8ee6

TODAY is Election Day if you’re in Gaithersburg or Rockville. Make sure you make your voice heard and vote!   If you live in: ☑️Rockville drop off your ballot or register and vote at City Hall by 8pm.  ☑️Gaithersburg find your polling place here: https://t.co/TJZHLFYmub

I lost my nephew Ian to a fentanyl overdose at the age of 24.   With impending lawsuit settlements from Purdue Pharma and other drug companies that caused the opioid crisis we must make sure we put the money toward solutions that work.  https://t.co/bQkp3S6ztD

Great to join two Maryland legends last night at the MD Dem Party gala: @SpeakerPelosi and @LeaderHoyer. Our party is strong and united. Let’s keep the House Ditch Mitch and Dump Trump in 2020. https://t.co/gz8yoB2eoO

What could be more frightening on Halloween than Mitch McConnell’s Senate graveyard? The House has passed meaningful legislation that has gone to die in the Senate.   It’s time for Mitch to call a vote. #HR1 #HR5 #HR6 #HR7 #HR8 #HR9 #HR1585 #HR1644 https://t.co/nR8EvfWnCf
Senate President Mike Miller is a tireless champion for all in Maryland and @SenBillFerg has the values and intelligence to fill these big shoes. I look forward to working with him.

Today we celebrate Elijah Cummings the son of sharecroppers and a giant of the House of Representatives. Baltimore Maryland and the entire country will miss your voice and leadership. https://t.co/7HX6dGCZHv
Thankful and grateful that @Willcsmithjr a hero and leader is home safely. We are lucky to have him in Montgomery County.  https://t.co/Lug2EHkvaL

It was great to meet the men and women of UAW 171 while walking the picket line on this cold and rainy day today. They are going to continue to fight for their rights and I stand with them. I hope that Volvo and UAW can come to an agreement soon so everyone can get back to work. https://t.co/qTQ0d4Lpvg
The President is using his office for personal gain. This is plain wrong and an abuse of power.   https://t.co/l1conJeCq1

Elijah Cummings was a voice to the powerless and a tireless advocate for his city and our state. He offered fairness and decency to all who crossed his path. June and I are heartbroken for Maya and the Cummings family. We also know his legacy will live on as model for all.
The opioid epidemic is the number one problem in America. Glad it is getting the attention it deserves  tonight on the national debate stage. We must end this crisis once and for all.
Team Trone was happy to be a part of the annual Autumn Glory parade in Garrett County. Thanks to everyone for coming out! https://t.co/tIdMhz0btc
Team Trone had a fabulous day in Germantown celebrating Oktoberfest. It was a great day of community food and music. Prost! https://t.co/Rb9QqpK7Hy
Team Trone had a great time celebrating Poolesville Day with District 15 Democrats this weekend! https://t.co/tDu4xEWM11

Thank you to the over 200 people that came out last night for our picnic in Hagerstown to discuss the progress we are making for Western Maryland.   Thanks to @BrianFrosh Emily Keller Sherriff Doug Mullendore Jason Malott and Kevin Simmers for your support. https://t.co/ZGx5pMy51q
Another outrageous attempt to change the very fabric of our country and another distraction from the outrage that is the President’s inaction on gun violence.   https://t.co/UDO4tfEYbU

Grateful to see more and more Democratic Presidential candidates releasing plans to #EndtheAddictionCrisis. Today @PeteButtigieg released a bold plan. The opioid & addiction epidemic is the number one issue facing our nation and we must act with urgency. https://t.co/NDN8kZ0go1

Thanks to Tom Dabney Dr. Nathan Sorber Judy Carbone Lisa Jan and Sue Lisantti for the conversation about how we can leverage the great aspects of Garrett County to create a better economy for everyone.

I had a fantastic dinner last night with some great folks in Garrett County.   We discussed access to broadband the growing opioid and meth problem how we can save rural schools and increase revenue from state funds and the struggle to develop the workforce in Garrett County. https://t.co/ptzqrx6kt5

June and I are sending our best wishes to Justice Ginsburg and praying for her full recovery. If history is any indication this is another hurdle that Justice Ginsburg will undoubtedly overcome with strength and grace. She will be in our thoughts during this time.

As we mourn the loss of the victims in Gilroy El Paso and Dayton we must demand change. H.R. 8 has been sitting on ⁦⁦@senatemajldr’s⁩ desk since February. McConnell needs to bring it to a vote and we as a nation need to pressure him to do so. https://t.co/DVHGbQ7U7i

Team Trone couldn’t have asked for better weather for the United Democrats of Frederick County picnic on Saturday! There was so much energy in the crowd and we’re looking forward to carrying that enthusiasm into 2020. https://t.co/WEYs07tw8B
I couldn’t agree more.   https://t.co/xqveieyvfM

Team Trone had a great time attending Senator Joanne Benson's gathering this week in Mitchellville. For decades Senator Benson has been a champion for Marylanders in her district and across the state. We can all learn from her leadership. https://t.co/ITy6V7HKni

Kevin and Dana Simmers have brought so much awareness to the opioid epidemic by sharing the story of their daughter Brooke with the world. 192 lives are taken every day from opioids and we must continue fighting until we put an end to this epidemic.  https://t.co/JF8Hlav0F8

I was proud to help lead this effort to raise the minimum wage to $15 by 2025. As a business owner I know that paying people a living wage is a win for business a win for American workers and a win for the economy.   https://t.co/VcSDLi4yej

There was so much energy at Hagerstown Pride this weekend! Team Trone had a great time meeting and connecting with the people of Hagerstown as they celebrated their 8th Annual Pride festival. The event was a reminder of the strength of our communities and that #loveislove. https://t.co/I3oaif6VfY

It was great to seeing so many this weekend at my Inaugural Summer BBQ with @ChrisVanHollen.  I hope to keep this summer BBQ tradition going in the years to come as we continue to build a strong community working towards a brighter future for Maryland. https://t.co/ILZ1Fz4liU
Thanks for coming out and being such a great Montgomery County partner @amfriedson! https://t.co/BBge9gZRIV
I had a great time walking in the Kentlands parade today to celebrate our country’s independence. Wishing your family a safe and happy Fourth of July! https://t.co/kzxbXGjLVJ

I’m in public service to lead and be a voice for people who don’t have PACs or lobbyists.  We can’t stand on the sidelines; we must step up.  Hear me talk about this and more in an interview with channel 5’s Tom Fitzgerald. https://t.co/AhEPSubmoF

One of my first actions in Congress was creating the Freshmen Working Group on Addiction. I knew that our historic freshman class could make real progress if we worked together - and we are. Read more below about what we're doing to end this epidemic. https://t.co/4XiUwKGys5

Western Maryland is a great place to live and work.  But we need to do more to attract businesses to the area and foster economic growth. It starts with broadband access - it's impossible to run a business without it. https://t.co/TlMOyWNcsq

Strong performance tonight from @JohnDelaney. His bipartisan carbon tax plan is the kind of policy we need to move our country forward and he’s got a realistic plan to tackle the addiction crisis.   NBC should give his ideas more time.

I grew up on a struggling family farm and I know firsthand that farmers face serious challenges. That's why I'm spending time with Western Maryland farmers listening to them directly about their concerns and working to find solutions. https://t.co/7pf1za2d3X
Today we saw how diversity and unity make our communities stronger happier and a better place to live. Frederick is a shining example of these values. https://t.co/yQqaOhKJzL

Frederick looked brighter than ever today for Frederick Pride! Thanks to Josh Cramer from the Central Committee for showing me the best spots around Pride and to County Executive @JanGardnerExec @KenKerr3B and County Councilman @kaihagen for your leadership in Frederick. https://t.co/NVRZijGGuM

Proud to work with Rep. Andy Kim to secure $500 million in funding for opioid addiction research. This epidemic is my top priority and this funding is part of the comprehensive approach that the bipartisan Freshman Working Group on Addiction is taking. https://t.co/wr7ar4MIzY

When I'm in Accident I always have to stop by one of my favorite Sixth District small businesses - @FireFlyCheese. Founded in 2002 by Mike and Pablo their cheeses have won multiple awards and are hand-crafted right here in Garrett County. https://t.co/EtaaVPzvID

Getting more folks trained to use Naloxone can save lives. My staff and I all took a Naloxone training and I'm calling for all members and their staffs to do the same. It's a great way that we can all lead by example!  https://t.co/jqPXq7f68V

I'm appalled by the Trump Administration's decision to cut educational and recreational programs for unaccompanied minors in CBP custody. How we treat these CHILDREN reflects who we are as a nation. https://t.co/LZzPjASXA5

When I ran for Congress I promised to increase the number of district offices from two to four. We're well on our way with the grand opening of our third office in Hagerstown. We're here for constituent service we love to do it and we do it well! https://t.co/BDbcdHZTni

Thank you Lillia Rose for introducing me at the Garrett County Democratic Dinner last night. Young people like Lillia inspire me and are leading the fight for positive change in our country. Our future is bright with people like her involved in politics. https://t.co/H6UD6qJTEo

Last week I held an education week tour meeting with educators all throughout the district. We have to think long-term and invest in our children and their children. It's key to addressing so many of the problems that our nation faces. https://t.co/O0oVtHCOKB

Honored to speak at the Washington County Democratic Central Committee Dinner with @Mayarockeymoore. Democrats are working hard to move the needle on key issues including education the economy and the opioid crisis.  https://t.co/ncWlqo71Y9

The Pittsburgh Institute of Aeronautics was rated the No. 1 trade school by Forbes magazine. Last week I visited the Washington County campus to learn more about how they're training our young people for the jobs of the future.  https://t.co/ivTsOZOiDS
Proud to be the Keynote for the Garrett County Democrats Kennedy/Roosevelt Dinner this Friday. Be sure to get your tickets now. You don't want to miss it! https://t.co/CaJ3jws5uu

Read my @washingtonpost op-ed. @GovLarryHogan vetoed "ban the box" legislation for private employers. I know he was wrong because my company was one of the first national businesses to stop asking for criminal histories on job applications. https://t.co/p0jXcOJGLZ
Sorry to miss this event on Sunday. @RepCummings is a true champion for Maryland and I am grateful for his leadership on behalf of our young people. https://t.co/RVTLv66vij

Last week I met with educators in Frederick County. One topic that repeatedly came up is helping students with mental health issues. My staff and I are working to help schools take advantage of federal grants to address this challenge. https://t.co/RjBI18c0pv

Asian Pacific Heritage month is an important celebration of the history and achievements of Asian Pacific Americans. I'm proud to represent a diverse district with a large Asian Pacific American community and to be a member of the Congressional Asian Pacific Caucus.

I'm proud to announce a $200000 federal grant that will help Allegany County develop comprehensive strategies to combat the opioid epidemic. Solving this crisis is priority #1.   https://t.co/oWBXFwfcWK

Between the picnics baseball games and concerts it can be easy to forget what Memorial Day is really about. Over 1 million American service-members have given their lives to protect our country. Today we honor them.

Disappointed by @GovLarryHogan's  veto of “ban-the-box.” My company & many others have positive experience helping returning citizens.  Not giving a second chance extends sentences and raises the odds of recidivism.  I hope the legislature will override.

Verso owes answers to the nearly 700 employees and their families who will be affected by the closing of the mill in Luke. The way that this has been handled is completely unacceptable. https://t.co/yhZp1rFAfg
Had a great time at the MCDCC brunch yesterday. Wonderful to see people from so many diverse communities coming together to help Democrats win big in 2020! https://t.co/2d7GZPd5ir

Government has no business interfering with women's health care decisions. Congress should pass the Freedom of Choice Act to ensure that women across the country are able to access safe and legal abortion care. #StopTheBans

What an awesome turnout for the Asbury Democratic Club meeting today! Over 80 folks came to discuss key issues like social security the opioid crisis and bringing civility back to the government. Participation is crucial for democracy. https://t.co/kjp67Hm20T

Today is the 65th anniversary of Brown v. Board. For all the progress we've made it's shameful how far we still have to go. Last month I asked Betsy DeVos if segregation threatens educational opportunities for children of color. She refused to answer. https://t.co/5ojv2hBzoM

A lot of people told me it was impractical to open an office in Cumberland - but I did anyway because I know it's crucial to be in the community serving constituents. Thanks to everyone who packed the house for our grand opening! https://t.co/fLwOvNV2IY

Senators Cardin & Van Hollen & I met with Mayor Clemons to discuss the Verso mill in Luke closing. The way this was handled by Verso is totally unacceptable and we will do everything we can to help the nearly 700 employees and their families. https://t.co/ukp1oWdOUH

Thanks to @RepLucyMcBath @LesleyJLopez @JosephSakran @NateTinbite and over 370 people who came out to our gun violence prevention forum. Rep. McBath is right this is a national public health crisis. The Senate needs to pass universal background checks. https://t.co/esUVzJs92h

Solving the opioid crisis is priority #1. That's why I'm proud to have founded the Freshman Working Group on Addiction. Our first of many bills will authorize $5 billion to help state and tribal governments combat this devastating epidemic. https://t.co/frpemjywAM
I started my business with one store and because of the support of my customers I was able to grow it into much more. #SupportSmallBusiness #NationalSmallBusinessWeek

Trump gave billions to the wealthiest corporations and stuck working people with the bill. Gold-star families are seeing taxes on survivor benefits go up this year because of the #GOPTaxScam.  https://t.co/4tjUE8BPfS

May is Mental Health Awareness Month. 1 in 5 adults have a mental health condition but nearly 60% do not get treatment. Please know that there's no shame in getting help. #EndTheStigma #MentalHealthMonth
What an amazing event we had last night celebrating women running for office. As Speaker Pelosi says - our diversity is our strength our power is our unity. https://t.co/c76Qe7vsr6
The first amendment to our constitution guarantees freedom of the press. It's important that Americans understand and celebrate this freedom even if our President doesn't. #WorldPressFreedomDay
Thanks @amyklobuchar for your commitment to finding solutions on this crucial issue. #MentalHealthMonth https://t.co/U6MVZ5PNQQ
Thanks @JohnDelaney for your commitment to finding solutions on this crucial issue. #MentalHealthMonth https://t.co/QPXSnuchKm
A big shout-out to the activists who testified in support of the ERA this week. It's long past time for a constitutional guarantee that women have equal rights. #ERANow https://t.co/4dHPCsLM6j

I asked Sec. Acosta what the minimum wage should be - he refused to answer. I asked Sec. DeVos if school segregation is harmful - she refused to answer. Trump officials' refusal to answer basic questions is shameful. https://t.co/yH2wN8MSqF

Proud to support the Climate Action Now Act that requires Trump to fulfill our obligations under the Paris Agreement. We have an obligation to do what's best for the next generation. https://t.co/wzUU45Rocy

Historic day! Congrats to @DelegateAJones first African American AND first woman to be House Speaker. About time! Dels Davis & McIntosh showed commitment to Maryland.  Look forward to working with all 3.

Congratulations to Jason and Mike Trippett and the Hoffman's team for being selected as the Official Hot Dog of the Baltimore Orioles. A big win for Washington County and the Sixth District! https://t.co/FlnAozSJ5b

I've often shared the story of my nephew Ian who tragically died from an overdose at age 24. And now I'm asking you to share your story. Visit the Freshman Working Group on Addiction website below to learn more. https://t.co/LcXMIOmOHW

I asked Betsy DeVos whether racial segregation poses a threat to educational opportunities for children of color. She refused to answer the straightforward question not once but twice. That's truly shameful. https://t.co/5ojv2hBzoM
An #EarthDay reminder that ignoring climate change isn't a solution. We have to act now or our children and grandchildren will pay the price. https://t.co/ms4k93iTxz

When I ran for Congress I promised that the days of Western Maryland being left behind are over. I'm proud to announce that the House passed my amendment to spur development of broadband in rural areas. In the 21st century broadband is a necessity. https://t.co/aDoOxNhAsY

Happy birthday to our fearless leader @SpeakerPelosi whose experience and guidance make being a Freshmen Member of the House of Representatives a navigable role. Your ability to fight for Democratic values while still valuing compromise makes you unparalleled in Congress.
Picks have officially been made! Who’s planning to cheer on Maryland this afternoon? #MarchMadness https://t.co/7OZCaqmGqo
Today I learned the basics of how to play a bagpipe. I think I’ll leave the piping to the professionals! https://t.co/hTSDSTZQ86
Everyone was out today at the St. Patrick’s Day Parade in Gaithersburg! It was great seeing all of the Irish spirit and the talented young performers. https://t.co/UmW28zyEns

This weekend I met w/ leaders in our Jewish community to talk about how we can pass policies that support the Jewish community in our district and around the world. With the rise in anti-Semitism we’ve seen lately it’s important we reaffirm our support for the Jewish people. https://t.co/FXVu4vlurq

Today we think about the dream that Martin Luther King Jr. envisioned for our country where people of all skin colors religions and creeds could come together as a nation. This dream should be a guide for all of us as we strive for equality diversity and inclusivity.

I had a really productive conversation today with leaders in the Latino community. We talked about early childhood education comprehensive immigration reform and getting the government open. I’m looking forward to working with this group to solve some of these problems. https://t.co/lPj0tDHNnC
